channel.title: NIOSH Health Hazard Evaluation Program
channel.description: You are viewing a feed that contains frequently updated content. When you subscribe to a feed, it is added to the Common Feed List. Updated information from the feed is automatically downloaded to your computer and can be viewed in Internet Explorer and other programs.

item.title: New Health Hazard Evaluation Report Available
item.description: HHE Program investigators found that forest management employees were exposed to airborne erionite mineral fibers. We recommended against repairing roads with aggregate that contained erionite. We also recommended controlling dust exposures with ventilated vehicle cabs, wet methods, and other work practices. Report available here: http://go.usa.gov/cmkQV.

item.title: New Health Hazard Evaluation Report Available
item.description: HHE Program investigators found diallyl disulfide and other compounds that can cause eye and respiratory irritation in the garlic chopping and cooking areas of a food processing company. We recommend improving the ventilation, limiting employee access to the cooking area, and determining cartridge change-out schedule for respirators. Report available here: http://go.usa.gov/cmkQh.
